file_content.text: I'm glad we could resolve this like civilized people. You'll receive your payment shortly.
I'm grateful we came to a civilized conclusion. Goodbye.
My beautiful children! You killed them all! Why?
You have something that belongs to Drooga the Hutt.
Please, kill me....
Captain, it's that girl from the holo. Momi Andrell. What did the sick filth-heap do to her?
Lazhae used me for experiments. Did terrible things. I'm dying.
He'll pay for what he's done to you.
He won't get away with it.
I don't care about revenge.
I'm just here for the creature.
That's your problem.
What? We've got to help her.
Free the shanjaru. I'm begging you.
What did you expect, thief?
Thief or not, nobody deserves this.
Don't let him keep that beautiful beast. He's sick.
Silence, test subject. The shanjaru is invaluable to my research. I need it.
The species displays evidence of evolving sapience. I must unlock its secrets to engineer my perfect life form!
Slaves. He wants to make slaves.
"Smart beasts" that comprehend complex commands and perform multi-stage tasks. What the buyers do with them is their business.
Why did you experiment on this poor woman?
You tortured that girl.
I certainly wasn't about to use my children.
In other words, all you care about is the money.
This is about profit.
Great strides in knowledge always come at a price.
How much would these "smart beasts" sell for?
Sounds expensive.
Enough to fund my dream of a galaxy filled with intelligent creatures built from my designs. "Lazhaens," if you will.
I have no desire for hostilities with Drooga or his agents. I extracted genetic samples from the shanjaru. They'll have to suffice.
This beast cage is a programmable repulsorlift vehicle. I'll send it to Drooga immediately....
Drooga only wants the shanjaru so he can eat the last of a species!
And the Hutt will have his meal shortly. There's no reason for more violence.
What you did to Momi is reason enough, you filth.
Wrong, you sick scum.
How can you take her side? Her kind would leave us rotting in ignorance.
The way I see it, I deserve something for all my time and effort.
You still owe me.
I returned Drooga's beast unharmed. What more do you want?
The shanjaru's genetic samples are the only way to save the species. Get them from Lazhae.
Wait! I'll pay whatever it takes to keep these samples. Leave me in peace, so I can finish my research.
Hand over the genetic samples and run for your life.
Hand over the samples and go.
Take them! Blast you to the void, I was so close to a breakthrough!
You're extinct, you lunatic.
Not interested. [Kill him.]
No, stop! My mind is worth too much!
Thank you. Take the genetic samples to the Senate Tower on Coruscant. A researcher named Daru'da can clone the shanjaru--re-populate the species.
It will be my dying legacy. Lazhae injected me with awful diseases. Incurable ones.
The pain is horrible. I don't want to live like this. Please, kill me.
Your father is rich, right? He can afford treatments to help you.
Don't lose hope. [Free her.]
Maybe you're right. I'll... I'll try. Thank you....
After all the trouble you've caused me, you can just rot in your cage.
A waste of ammo. [Leave her.]
No matter what she's done, that's cruel. What's wrong with you, Captain?
At least the shanjaru will survive.
As you wish. [Kill her.]
Thank you.
You just bought my silence, doc.
You've got a deal. [Take bribe.]
No... no!
I can't believe this. What have you gotten me into?
I'm glad we could be reasonable. Please excuse me. I have work to do.
Agreed.
Are you out of your mind? We can't leave this woman in a cage!
Let the woman go, Lazhae.
I suppose not.
She broke the law, Corso. Prison is where she belongs.
She brought this on herself.
This doesn't feel like justice to me.
Watch me.
I'm starting to think I signed up with the wrong side.
Extend my sincerest apologies to Drooga. I trust there won't be any lingering resentment.
Let the woman go, and I'll put in a good word for you.
Free the woman, too.
Certainly. She's of no further use to me.
You're insane, all of you. Insane!
Can't disagree with her. This whole deal has made me sick to my stomach.
He might decide to kill you anyway. Hard to say.
Maybe, maybe not.
Perhaps I should relocate somewhere safer in this accursed prison....
Shut up.
Farewell. As we say to visitors in Shadow Town, "may you never return as a resident."
How dare you invade my laboratory! Get out!
He won't get away with it.
He won't get away with it.
That's your problem.
That's your problem.
What did you expect, thief?
What did you expect, thief?
Wrong, you sick scum.
Wrong, you sick scum.
Agreed.
Agreed.
Hand over the samples and go.
Hand over the samples and go.
Not interested. [Kill him.]
Not interested. [Kill him.]
You've got a deal. [Take bribe.]
You've got a deal. [Take bribe.]
Don't lose hope. [Free her.]
Don't lose hope. [Free her.]
A waste of ammo. [Leave her.]
A waste of ammo. [Leave her.]
As you wish. [Kill her.]
As you wish. [Kill her.]
I suppose not.
I suppose not.
She brought this on herself.
She brought this on herself.
Watch me.
Watch me.
Free the woman, too.
Free the woman, too.
Maybe, maybe not.
Maybe, maybe not.
Shut up.
Shut up.
